entries.title: Bangladesh to get $4.7bn IMF package
entries.description: The funding comes under a new programme which aims to help vulnerable middle-income countries and island states.

entries.title: US not interested in pressing Israel amid violence: Experts
entries.description: US will continue to prop up 'status quo', analysts say, as Blinken visits region following spate of deadly attacks.

entries.title: Brazil’s ex-President Bolsonaro seeks US tourist visa: Lawyer
entries.description: Application for six-month US visa comes as Jair Bolsonaro faces accusations he helped incite riot in Brazil's capital.

entries.title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy says Russia’s ‘big revenge’ has begun
entries.description: President Zelenskyy had warned for weeks that Moscow sought to step up assaults after months of virtual stalemate.

entries.title: Was India’s Hockey World Cup failure a missed opportunity?
entries.description: The national field hockey team finished tied for ninth place at a home World Cup. What went wrong?

entries.title: Will the Ukraine war become a wider European conflict?
entries.description: Kyiv calls for fighter jets after Germany agrees to allow the deployment of Leopard 2 tanks.

entries.title: Germany pledges millions to help Brazil protect Amazon rainforest
entries.description: German minister says Brazil's new government offers 'great chance' to protect rainforest after widespread destruction.

entries.title: Turkey opposition vows to cut presidential powers if it wins vote
entries.description: Alliance of opposition parties presents 240-page programme ahead of presidential and parliamentary elections.

entries.title: Tyre Nichols case renews calls for changes to US policing
entries.description: Structural changes are desperately needed, advocates say, as the US deals with another case of fatal police violence.

entries.title: India’s Adani firms lose $65bn in value
entries.description: Led by Asia's richest man Gautam Adani, the group has locked horns with short seller Hindenburg Research.

entries.title: Blinken urges calm, reaffirms ‘ironclad’ US support for Israel
entries.description: Top US diplomat pays tribute to Israeli victims of attack in Jerusalem without mentioning Palestinians killed by Israel.

entries.title: How Putin made himself Maidan-proof by waging war on Ukraine
entries.description: Since 2014, the conflict in Ukraine has been tightly linked to Putin's fear of an opposition-led challenge to his rule.

entries.title: World ‘dangerously unprepared’ for next pandemic, Red Cross warns
entries.description: World's largest humanitarian network says strong preparedness systems 'severely lacking' despite three years of COVID.

entries.title: Gandhi’s 150-day march is over. But will it revive Congress?
entries.description: Leader of India's main opposition party concludes cross-country 'unity' march in Kashmir.

entries.title: Croatian president slams Western arms to Ukraine
entries.description: President Zoran Milanovic has repeatedly criticised Western policies towards Russia and the Balkans.

entries.title: UK cost-of-living crisis pushes mothers to the brink
entries.description: In the midst of the biggest surge in prices in decades, food banks have become a feature of modern British life.

entries.title: Russian troops have left this Ukrainian village, but fear remains
entries.description: Liberation has not diminished the hardship for Kalynivske residents, both those returning and the ones who never left.

entries.title: Dozens killed in bombing at mosque in Pakistan’s Peshawar
entries.description: A blast at a mosque inside the police headquarters in Peshawar killed at least 32 worshippers and wounded 150 more.

entries.title: Conflict survivors to meet Pope Francis on his DR Congo trip
entries.description: Pope’s long-awaited visit to DRC and South Sudan where two of the world’s most neglected crises are ongoing.

entries.title: Jenin refugee camp residents defiant after deadly Israeli assault
entries.description: Palestinians pledge to 'keep fighting' illegal Israeli occupation following largest military raid in Jenin since 2002.

entries.title: Iran summons Ukraine’s envoy over drone attack comments
entries.description: Move comes after Zelenskyy adviser appeared to directly link Ukraine with attack on military facility in central Iran.

entries.title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian man in Hebron as tensions spiral
entries.description: Naseem Abu Fouda, 26, is the 35th Palestinian to be killed by Israel so far in January 2023.

entries.title: Can Bola Tinubu, Nigeria’s ailing kingmaker, win the presidency?
entries.description: Tinubu has a formidable political machinery & is credited with Lagos's successes, but can he become Nigerian president?

entries.title: UK’s Boris Johnson says Putin threatened him with missile attack
entries.description: Former British PM says Russian president threatened him during a phone call in the run up to Ukraine invasion.

entries.title: Another uprising is in the making in Tunisia
entries.description: President Saeid's decision to turn to the IMF to save Tunisia's economy will sound the death knell for his regime.

entries.title: In Ivory Coast, people with leprosy fight social exclusion
entries.description: In Ivory Coast, people living with leprosy say they often face social exclusion. Some now live together in a commune.

entries.title: Apocalypse in Palestine: The rise of Israeli fanaticism
entries.description: Israel’s fanatics do not want a democratic state, they want a religious kingdom.

entries.title: Dozens injured in blast at busy mosque in Pakistan’s Peshawar
entries.description: Officials say an explosion at a mosque in Peshawar, northwestern Pakistan, has caused multiple casualties.

entries.title: Cyclone in Madagascar kills dozens, displaces tens of thousands
entries.description: At least 25 confirmed dead and more than 37,000 displaced by Cyclone Cheneso, authorities say.

entries.title: Gunmen kill eight people at birthday party in South Africa
entries.description: Police say three others were wounded in southern port city of Gqeberha and a manhunt for the perpetrators is under way.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 341
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 341st day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: NATO chief asks S Korea to ‘step up’ military support for Ukraine
entries.description: Jens Stoltenberg suggests Seoul reconsider its policy of barring weapons exports to countries in conflict.

entries.title: Rio Tinto apologises as search for radioactive capsule continues
entries.description: A radiation alert is in force for parts of Western Australia after a tiny capsule containing Caesium-137 was lost.

entries.title: Missile hits Kharkiv apartment block, killing at least one
entries.description: Three people were injured in the raid, and rescue teams are searching for an elderly woman thought to be trapped.

entries.title: Erdogan says Turkey may accept Finland in NATO, but not Sweden
entries.description: Turkey and Hungary are the only members of the 30-nation alliance yet to approve the Nordic nations' application.
